text.text: Perfect! Here's a comprehensive overview of the *`adapter/`* directory:
The adapter directory contains *16 different web framework adapters* that allow Bolt apps to run on various Python web frameworks and platforms:

‣ *`flask/`* - Flask integration (sync)
‣ *`fastapi/`* - FastAPI integration (async)
‣ *`django/`* - Django integration
‣ *`sanic/`* - Sanic async framework
‣ *`starlette/`* - Starlette async framework
‣ *`tornado/`* - Tornado framework (both sync & async)
‣ *`falcon/`* - Falcon REST framework
‣ *`bottle/`* - Bottle micro-framework
‣ *`pyramid/`* - Pyramid web framework
‣ *`cherrypy/`* - CherryPy framework
‣ *`aiohttp/`* - AIOHTTP async framework

‣ *`aws_lambda/`* - AWS Lambda serverless (includes Chalice support)
  ↳ Handler for Lambda functions
  ↳ Chalice framework handler
  ↳ S3-based OAuth flow
  ↳ Lazy listener runners

‣ *`socket_mode/`* - WebSocket-based Socket Mode (no HTTP endpoint needed)
  ↳ Multiple implementations: `builtin`, `aiohttp`, `websockets`, `websocket_client`
  ↳ Both sync and async handlers

‣ *`asgi/`* - Generic ASGI adapter (for any ASGI-compatible framework)
  ↳ Builtin and AIOHTTP implementations
‣ *`wsgi/`* - Generic WSGI adapter (for any WSGI-compatible framework)

‣ `__init__.py` - Exports the handler class
‣ `handler.py` or `async_handler.py` - Main handler implementation
‣ Some have additional support files for OAuth, lazy listeners, etc.
This comprehensive adapter collection means you can run Bolt apps on *virtually any Python web framework or cloud platform*!
